fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.asynccall

Class AsyncCallServerPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.asynccall.AsyncCallServerPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginI, java.io.Serializable

    public class AsyncCallServerPlugin
extends AbstractPlugin
    The class AsyncCallServerPlugin implements a protocol to be called asynchronously by another component to which the result is sent back using another asynchronous call.

    Description

    To use this plug-in properly, a server classical component must first create an instance of the plug-in, set its URI (as usual for plug-ins), set its preferred execution service URI and then install it.

    In asynchronous calls, the caller provides the URI of an inbound port to which the server must connect to send back the result of the call when it becomes available. In this implementation of the server-side plug-in, the choice is made to connect to this inbound port once at the first reception of a call from a given client and not to disconnect until the uninstallation of the plug-in. If a lot of clients are used, this choice should be changed to connect/disconnect at result sending time.

    TODO: One limitation of the current implementation is the thread safety that can be challenged if the call can be executed in parallel with the connection of the outbound port used to return the result. No waiting is put in place to ensure that this connection is done before the method sendResult is called, hence it is possible that the precondition that this connection has been done before the call to sendResult may fail due to race conditions.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2021-04-13

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
